title: Linguine with Green Beans, Tomatoes, and Basil
introduction: Linguine with Green Beans, Tomatoes, and Basil is a delightful pasta dish typical of Puglia, Italy. This dish features the fresh flavors of green beans, ripe tomatoes, and aromatic basil, tossed together with linguine and finished with a creamy touch of ricotta salata. It's a perfect representation of the region's love for simple yet flavorful ingredients and can be enjoyed as a refreshing meal any day of the week.
ingredients: 5 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped (about 3 cups)
1 cup grated ricotta salata, mild feta, or fresh ricotta
instructions: Bring about 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the green beans and salt to taste. Cook 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Scoop out the green beans with a slotted spoon or strainer, reserving the water. Pat the beans dry. Cut the beans into 1-inch lengths.
Pour the oil into a skillet large enough to hold the cooked pasta. Add the garlic and cook over medium-low heat until lightly golden, about 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes thicken and the juices evaporate. Stir in the beans. Simmer 5 minutes more.

Meanwhile, bring the pot of water back to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons of salt, then the linguine, gently pushing it down until the pasta is completely covered with water. Cook over high heat, stirring frequently, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Set aside some of the cooking water. Drain the pasta and add it to the skillet with the sauce.
Toss the linguine with the sauce in the skillet. Add the basil and cheese and toss again over medium heat until the cheese is creamy. Serve immediately.
